name: Bold.org - Women in Technology Scholarship
description: $500-$5,000 scholarship for female high school students pursuing computer science or technology degrees. Open to students demonstrating passion for technology and commitment to careers in tech. Essay required describing how you will use technology to make positive impact. Preference given to underrepresented minorities in tech. Renewable annually with reapplication. Funds can be used for tuition, books, technology, or educational expenses.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Technology, Software Engineering, IT

name: Bold.org - Future Black Tech Leaders Scholarship
description: $1,000-$10,000 scholarship specifically for Black high school students pursuing computer science, software engineering, or technology fields. Must demonstrate academic achievement (minimum 3.0 GPA) and passion for technology careers. Essay describing how you will contribute to increasing Black representation in tech industry. Preference for first-generation college students and students from low-income backgrounds. Letters of recommendation optional but encouraged.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Software Engineering, Technology, Programming

name: Bold.org - Coding for Change Scholarship
description: $500-$2,500 scholarship for students interested in using programming to create social impact. Open to all high school students learning to code or developing software applications. Submit portfolio of coding projects or description of app/website you want to build to help your community. No minimum GPA required. Judges evaluate creativity, technical skill, and potential social impact. Perfect for self-taught programmers.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Software Development, App Development

name: Bold.org - Cybersecurity Scholars Award
description: $1,000-$3,000 scholarship for students pursuing cybersecurity education and careers. Open to high school students interested in information security, ethical hacking, or cybersecurity. Essay describing importance of cybersecurity and your career goals. Participation in CyberPatriot or similar competitions helpful but not required. Priority for students from underrepresented groups in cybersecurity field.
stem_fields: Cybersecurity, Information Security, Computer Science, Ethical Hacking

name: Bold.org - Future Engineers Scholarship
description: $500-$5,000 scholarship for high school students pursuing engineering degrees. All engineering disciplines eligible including mechanical, electrical, civil, chemical, and biomedical. Essay describing engineering problem you want to solve and impact it would have. Minimum 3.0 GPA preferred. Special consideration for students from low-income families and first-generation college students. One-time award for college expenses.
stem_fields: Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering

name: Bold.org - Black Women in Engineering Scholarship
description: $2,000-$10,000 scholarship exclusively for Black female students pursuing engineering degrees. Addressing underrepresentation of Black women in engineering fields. Essay about overcoming challenges and commitment to engineering career. Minimum 2.5 GPA required. Participation in STEM clubs, robotics teams, or engineering competitions encouraged. Preference for students demonstrating financial need.
stem_fields: Engineering, STEM, Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering

name: Bold.org - Renewable Energy Engineering Scholarship
description: $1,000-$4,000 scholarship for students passionate about sustainable energy and environmental engineering. Open to students planning to study renewable energy, environmental engineering, or sustainable design. Essay describing how you will contribute to clean energy future. Projects or research in solar, wind, or green technology highly valued. No GPA requirement.
stem_fields: Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Renewable Energy, Sustainability

name: Bold.org - Robotics and Automation Scholarship
description: $500-$3,000 scholarship for students interested in robotics engineering, automation, or mechatronics. Participation in FIRST Robotics, VEX Robotics, or similar programs encouraged. Essay or video describing robot you designed or role on robotics team. Open to all skill levels. Emphasis on creativity and problem-solving rather than competition wins.
stem_fields: Robotics, Engineering, Automation, Mechatronics, Design

name: Bold.org - Math Excellence Scholarship
description: $500-$2,500 scholarship for students excelling in mathematics and pursuing math-related degrees. Open to students planning to major in mathematics, statistics, actuarial science, or applied mathematics. Submit transcript showing strong math performance. Essay describing favorite math concept and its real-world applications. Participation in Math Olympiad or MATHCOUNTS encouraged but not required.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Actuarial Science

name: Bold.org - Women in Mathematics Award
description: $1,000-$5,000 scholarship for female students pursuing mathematics education or careers. Addressing gender gap in mathematics fields. Essay about mathematical passion and how you will inspire other girls in math. Minimum 3.0 GPA in math courses. Priority for students from underrepresented minorities. One letter of recommendation from math teacher.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Pure Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Math Education

name: Bold.org - Data Science and Analytics Scholarship
description: $500-$3,000 scholarship for students interested in data science, statistics, or analytics careers. Open to students learning data analysis, statistical modeling, or machine learning. Submit portfolio of data projects or essay describing how data can solve societal problems. Knowledge of Python, R, or SQL helpful but not required. Emphasis on analytical thinking.
stem_fields: Data Science, Statistics, Analytics, Mathematics, Machine Learning

name: Bold.org - Future Scientists Scholarship
description: $500-$5,000 scholarship for students pursuing careers in natural sciences. Open to students interested in biology, chemistry, physics, or earth sciences. Essay describing scientific question you want to answer and methodology you would use. Science fair participation, research experience, or laboratory work encouraged. No minimum GPA but strong science grades preferred.
stem_fields: Science, Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Earth Science

name: Bold.org - Environmental Science Leaders Scholarship
description: $1,000-$4,000 scholarship for students passionate about environmental conservation and sustainability. Open to students pursuing environmental science, ecology, conservation biology, or climate science. Essay about environmental issue affecting your community and your proposed solution. Participation in environmental clubs or volunteer work valued. Priority for students demonstrating commitment to environmental justice.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Ecology, Conservation, Climate Science, Sustainability

name: Bold.org - Black Excellence in STEM Scholarship
description: $2,000-$10,000 scholarship specifically for Black students pursuing any STEM field. Recognizing and supporting Black excellence in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. Essay about your STEM journey, challenges overcome, and future goals. Minimum 2.5 GPA required. Strong preference for first-generation college students and students from low-income families. Multiple awards given annually.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Bold.org - Biomedical Science Scholarship
description: $1,000-$5,000 scholarship for students interested in biomedical sciences, medical research, or healthcare. Open to students pursuing biology, biochemistry, genetics, or pre-medicine. Essay describing disease or medical condition you want to research and why. Laboratory experience, science research, or healthcare volunteering encouraged. Commitment to improving healthcare outcomes.
stem_fields: Biomedical Science, Biology, Biochemistry, Genetics, Medical Research

name: Bold.org - Neuroscience Research Scholarship
description: $500-$3,000 scholarship for students fascinated by brain science and neuroscience. Open to students planning to study neuroscience, cognitive science, or neurobiology. Essay about neuroscience topic that interests you and its implications. Research experience helpful but not required. Suitable for students curious about consciousness, mental health, or brain disorders.
stem_fields: Neuroscience, Biology, Cognitive Science, Neurobiology, Psychology

name: Bold.org - Physics and Astronomy Scholarship
description: $500-$2,500 scholarship for students passionate about physics, astronomy, or astrophysics. Open to students taking physics courses or interested in space science. Essay describing physics concept that fascinates you or astronomical discovery you find inspiring. Participation in astronomy clubs, planetarium visits, or physics competitions encouraged. No GPA requirement.
stem_fields: Physics, Astronomy, Astrophysics, Space Science, Cosmology

name: Bold.org - Chemistry Innovation Scholarship
description: $500-$3,000 scholarship for students pursuing chemistry or chemical engineering. Open to students interested in organic chemistry, biochemistry, materials science, or pharmaceutical chemistry. Essay about chemical innovation or discovery that impacts daily life. Laboratory coursework or chemistry competitions encouraged. Judges value creativity and scientific curiosity.
stem_fields: Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Biochemistry, Materials Science, Pharmacy

name: Bold.org - First-Generation STEM Scholars
description: $1,000-$7,500 scholarship for first-generation college students pursuing any STEM degree. Open to students whose parents did not complete four-year college degree. Essay about challenges of being first-generation student and commitment to STEM education. Minimum 2.5 GPA required. Priority for students from underrepresented minorities and low-income families. Renewable with reapplication.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Bold.org - Rural STEM Students Scholarship
description: $500-$3,000 scholarship for students from rural communities pursuing STEM education. Recognizing unique challenges faced by rural students accessing STEM opportunities. Essay describing how rural background shapes your STEM interests and goals. Limited access to advanced courses or STEM programs will not count against you. Commitment to bringing STEM knowledge back to rural communities valued.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Bold.org - STEM for Social Good Scholarship
description: $500-$2,500 scholarship for students planning to use STEM to create positive social impact. Open to all STEM majors with community service orientation. Essay describing how you will apply STEM knowledge to help underserved communities. Volunteer work, community projects, or social entrepreneurship experience encouraged. No minimum GPA. Judges value compassion and commitment to equity.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Social Impact, Community Service, Applied STEM

name: Bold.org - Young Innovators STEM Award
description: $500-$5,000 scholarship for students demonstrating innovation and creativity in STEM. Open to students with inventions, research projects, apps, or creative STEM solutions. Submit portfolio or description of innovative project. All STEM fields eligible. Judges evaluate originality, technical execution, and potential impact. Perfect for students with entrepreneurial mindset.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Innovation, Entrepreneurship, Applied Science

name: Bold.org - Hispanic/Latinx STEM Excellence Scholarship
description: $1,000-$5,000 scholarship for Hispanic and Latinx students pursuing STEM careers. Addressing underrepresentation of Hispanic students in STEM fields. Essay about cultural identity and STEM aspirations. Minimum 2.5 GPA required. Priority for students overcoming economic hardship or educational barriers. Multiple awards available annually. Commitment to Hispanic STEM representation.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Bold.org - Students with Disabilities in STEM
description: $500-$3,000 scholarship for students with disabilities pursuing STEM education. Recognizing unique perspectives and challenges of disabled students in STEM. Essay about how disability shapes your STEM approach and goals. All disabilities eligible including physical, learning, mental health, and chronic illness. Commitment to accessible STEM education and careers.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Bold.org - Low-Income STEM Achievers Scholarship
description: $1,000-$7,500 scholarship for students from low-income families pursuing STEM degrees. Financial need-based award supporting students who face economic barriers to STEM education. Essay about overcoming financial challenges while pursuing STEM interests. Documentation of family income required. Minimum 2.5 GPA. Multiple large awards available annually for deserving students.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Bold.org - High School STEM Research Scholarship
description: $500-$3,000 scholarship for students conducting independent STEM research in high school. Open to students with science fair projects, research internships, or independent studies. Submit research abstract or project description. All STEM research topics eligible. Judges evaluate research quality, methodology, and student contribution. Perfect for aspiring researchers.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Research, Scientific Method, Independent Study
